title: What we learned at RugbyX: Dramatic and baffling in equal measure... but too many tries cheapened the spectacle
text:
This could have been thunderous, and may well turn out to be so in the future. RugbyX, World Rugby’s latest attempt at making the game more accessible, debuted at the O2 Arena to ambivalence and confusion among moments of fierce drama.

Five players per team, 10-minute matches, on half a pitch. Full contact, too, with uncontested scrums.

One vital difference from Sevens and XVs was the lineout. As soon as the ball crossed the touchline, the team who were awarded the throw could take it immediately, the throw executed by a substitute, standing poised on the sideline, ball in hand, ready for any such eventuality.
